result.execSummary:
The defendant Latoya M Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latoya M Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system

Defendant Latoya M Martin in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Plea - G.
BTC:  GUILTY.
30 days RCJ, cfts (20 days);
CC+DNA surcharge - provide sample, pp $25/mo beg 8-1-14, ftp 30 days RCJ for contempt.
FAW;
CRW.
  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
